subject: Management
title: From Change Manager to Change Leader
description: A 60-second lesson on From Change Manager to Change Leader.

hook.text: A project manager tracked every task of the transformation. It was on time and on budget. But nobody believed in it.

buildup.text: Change management is about plans and timelines. Change leadership is about hearts and minds.

discovery.text: Kotter: management produces orderly results. Leadership produces movement and energy.

twist.text: You need both. But most organizations over-manage change and under-lead it.

climax.text: Manage the tasks. But lead the people. Inspire, listen, model, and repeat the vision constantly.

punchline.text: Plans move timelines. Leaders move people.

quiz.question: What is the difference between change management and change leadership?
options: Management handles plans and tasks while leadership moves hearts and minds
There is no meaningful difference between the two
Change management is always more important than change leadership
